header.title: Announcing the AIPR Certificate in Parapsychology and AIPR Advanced Certificate in Parapsychology

central_thesis: The Australian Institute of Parapsychological Research (AIPR) offers Certificate and Advanced Certificate courses in Parapsychology to provide students with a comprehensive, scientifically-oriented education on paranormal phenomena, fostering critical thinking, research understanding, and effective communication within the field.

structure_content.summary: This section outlines the primary objective of the AIPR Certificate and Advanced Certificate in Parapsychology: to offer a comprehensive education on paranormal phenomena, emphasizing the application of scientific principles, critical thinking, understanding research challenges, recognizing the field's progressive nature, and clear communication of parapsychological findings.

The courses are unique, following a conventional higher-education (tertiary) design, comprising specific learning-area modules (units) with integrated online readings from the AIPR, which serves as the authorising body. While no formal entry requirement exists, secondary school completion is advised. Students unfamiliar with scientific parapsychology or statistical analysis are recommended to complete the Certificate before the Advanced Certificate. Each certificate requires the completion of 5 appropriate units.

This section details the introductory unit fees, which are AUD$125.00 (USD$96.00; EUR€75.00; GBP£50.00), with 'Contemporary Issues I and II' priced at AUD$100.00 (USD$75.00; EUR€60.00; GBP£40.00). Standard fees are double these amounts. A one-year free subscription to the 'Australian Journal of Parapsychology' (valued at AUD$50.00) is included for students paying for 5 units in advance. Fees for unattempted units are redeemable, minus a 10% administrative fee, but fees for failed units are non-refundable. Payment officially registers the applicant as a student and provides access to unit outlines.

Unit outlines provide online links to downloadable course materials, including essay topics, relevant articles, and book chapters. Materials are accessible prior to payment for informed decision-making, but only enrolled students are eligible to submit assignments for assessment. Materials can also be mailed to students without Internet access.

structure_content.chapter_title: AIPR Certificate in Parapsychology course units
structure_content.summary: Lists the seven units comprising the AIPR Certificate: 'History of Parapsychology (1882-1932)', 'The Parapsychology of J. B. Rhine', 'Survival or Super-Psi?', 'Extra-Ordinary Paranormal Feats', 'Conspiracy and Controversy in Parapsychology', 'Parapsychology-Present and Future', and 'Contemporary Issues in Parapsychology I (Open Unit)'.

structure_content.chapter_title: AIPR Advanced Certificate in Parapsychology course units
structure_content.summary: Lists the ten units comprising the AIPR Advanced Certificate: 'Methodology in Parapsychology (recommended)', 'Experimental Issues in Parapsychology', 'Sociological and Phenomenological Issues in Parapsychology', 'Survival Issues in Parapsychology', 'Characteristics of Believers in the Paranormal', 'Psi and Mainstream Science', 'The Theory of Psychopraxia', 'Synchronicity and Psi', 'Parapsychology and Astrology', and 'Contemporary Issues in Parapsychology II (Open Unit)'.

key_concepts.definition: A foundational educational program comprising five specific units designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of paranormal phenomena, awarded upon successful completion.

A higher-level educational program, recommended for those with prior foundational knowledge, also comprising five specific units, delving into more complex issues within parapsychology and awarded upon successful completion.
The academic field of inquiry concerned with the scientific study of claims and evidence for paranormal phenomena, emphasizing critical thinking and objective evaluation.
Individual modules that constitute the structured courses, each covering specific themes and issues in contemporary parapsychology, with associated readings and assignments.
The subject matter of parapsychological study, encompassing claims and evidence for phenomena outside the current scientific understanding, such as psychic abilities or survival after death.
The systematic methodology and critical approach applied throughout the courses for the study and evaluation of parapsychological claims and research findings.

practical_system.description: The practical system described is an academic course delivery model designed for the study of parapsychology. It's a structured educational pathway managed by the AIPR, allowing students to gain certification upon successful completion of designated units through a process of self-study and assessment.
tools: Internet access (for online course materials and unit outlines)
Digital or physical reading materials (articles, book chapters, essay topics)
Computer or writing tools (for preparing and submitting assignments)
AIPR administration and support staff (for registration, queries, and assessment processing)
The 'Australian Journal of Parapsychology' (as a supplementary resource and benefit for advance payment)
rituals: Select and enroll in specific course units.
Pay the required unit fees (or advance payment for 5 units).
Access course materials, primarily online (or via mail).
Study assigned readings, articles, and book chapters.
Receive a receipt and official student registration upon payment.
Notify administrators for withdrawal from a unit if unable to complete (for partial fee redemption).
Complete 5 appropriate units to be awarded the respective certificate.

relevant_quotes.text: The AIPR Certificate in Parapsychology and the AIPR Advanced Certificate in Parapsychology courses give students an education in the field of parapsychology by providing a comprehensive understanding and awareness of claims of, and evidence for, paranormal phenomena.

The main aim of these courses is to instil in students an orientation towards parapsychology that gives them the capacity to: acquire and apply knowledge relevant to a range of areas in parapsychology, appreciate the necessity of applying scientific principles to parapsychological studies, understand the problems faced by researchers in the study of paranormal phenomena, engage in critical thinking and objective evaluation of parapsychological research findings and other paranormal claims, accept the view that parapsychology is an accumulative field of inquiry that grows through continual break-through in theory development and experimental discoveries, communicate, clearly and concisely, basic assumptions and findings in the science of parapsychology.
There are no other courses like these in Australia or overseas, but they follow the conventional higher-education (tertiary) course design.
Completion of either course in 5 (five) appropriate units leads to the award of the AIPR Certificate in Parapsychology or AIPR Advanced Certificate in Parapsychology.

critical_analysis.relevance: This announcement is highly relevant for individuals seeking structured, tertiary-level education in parapsychology, particularly those in Australia or internationally interested in a scientific and critical approach to paranormal phenomena. It outlines a comprehensive curriculum covering historical, methodological, and contemporary issues in the field, positioning itself as a unique offering. While the content of parapsychology may touch upon phenomena sometimes associated with esotericism, the methodology described (scientific principles, objective evaluation, critical thinking) fundamentally distinguishes it from occult practice or philosophical exploration as understood within Western Esotericism and Magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists primarily of students interested in obtaining a formal education in parapsychology. This includes individuals who may or may not have completed secondary school (though it is recommended), those new to formal scientific parapsychology or statistical analysis (advised to start with the Certificate), and individuals seeking to develop critical thinking skills and a scientific orientation towards paranormal claims and research findings.
